messageBody:
For testing complex SQL queries I use a combination of DBUnit and HSQLDB. DBUnit (http://dbunit.sourceforge.net) is used to populate the database, which is a HSQLDB (http://hsqldb.org) instance fired up in the same VM as the test case. Hibernate's SchemaExport tool is useful to create tables, etc.

Of course, these are not strict, fast-running unit tests, but more of slower functional ones (let's say they take ten seconds instead of one). The nice thing is that they're isolated enough that you don't need an external database to run them.

-----Original Message-----
Arash Bijanzadeh wrote:
>
> I have a problem with the test dependencies. The application is a
> database backed application and I want to test the db functionality.
> For this purpose, first thing to be done is database populating which
> itself is a test suite. Is there any way to specify the order or tests
> in Junit? Or any other solution which suits this kind of scenarios?
> Thanks in advance,
> Arash
